verses.roman:
beḍā-saṅkīrtana tāhāṅ ārambha karilā
sāta-sampradāya tabe gāite lāgilā

synonyms: beḍā-saṅkīrtana—surrounding congregational chanting; tāhāṅ—there; ārambha karilā—began; sāta-sampradāya—seven groups; tabe—thereupon; gāite lāgilā—began to chant.
translation: After seeing Lord Jagannātha, Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu began His all-encompassing saṅkīrtana. He formed seven groups, which then began to chant.

purport.content: For an explanation of the beḍā-saṅkīrtana, one may refer to Madhya-līlā, Chapter Eleven, verses 215-238.
